dlentry.dd: If selected, personal or private information (such as email addresses, phone numbers, IDs, or API keys) is automatically identified and masked in AI requests to help protect sensitive data. You can extend this protection by adding custom patterns to cover additional data types in the table below the option. Click the New button under the table to configure a new rule pattern or the Edit button to edit an existing rule. You can also use Delete to remove them. The masked information is automatically restored in the AI response, ensuring that users see the correct content and that any generated or updated files remain accurate.
Opens a dialog box where you can test and see how specific data is masked before sending it to the AI.

Opens a confirmation dialog box that allows you to permanently delete all data stored by the AI Positron. This includes personal data (chat history, favorites, caches, recent actions, tokens, keys) and preference settings (stored in either Global Options or Project Options). In the confirmation dialog box, there is an option to also delete configuration files that are stored separately on disk.
